data.title: Farmers Weekly on LinkedIn: Young Farmer Lottie Williams drove her dad’s beloved Massey Ferguson 7618…
data.meta_description: Young Farmer Lottie Williams drove her dad’s beloved Massey Ferguson 7618 to prom in honour of him, almost a year to the day after losing him to motor neurone…
data.text:
🐎 Don't Let Summer Pastures Become a Silent Threat! Summer's here, and while lush fields are great for grazing, there's a hidden danger: Equine Grass Sickness (EGS). This potentially fatal disease can strike healthy horses. ✨ New On the Blog discusses the dangers and prevention. Click the link below to Extra, Extra, Read All About It! 👇 https://lnkd.in/gxUZKUrF

Rabies is deadly but preventable ⚠️ Will you share this infographic to raise awareness of the deadly rabies disease? 💉 It is time to stop the suffering and protect people and animals from rabies for good! Learn more about this life-saving mission at missionrabies.com

As #WorldRabiesDay quickly approaches, can you share this infographic to raise awareness of the deadly rabies disease? 💉 It is time to stop the suffering and protect people and animals from rabies for good! Find out more at missionrabies.com

"Spread awareness, not rabies! 🐾 Join us in commemorating #WorldRabiesDay and learn how you can protect both humans and animals from this deadly disease. Together, we can make a difference! 🌍🐶🐱 #RabiesPrevention #StayInformed #Starradilogy #telereportingcompany"

It is nearly unfathomable that a child dies from this disease every 9 minutes...because it is a terrible death, not a quick one, AND IT IS 100% PREVENTABLE. Take a minute to share this info with your network, and check out Mission Rabies to see how you can help #eraserabies by 2030. #vetmed #vetmedicine #zoonosis #rabies #petcare #petcareservices #petcaretips #infectiousdiseases #prevention

The CIS Johne’s Monitoring Services provides testing of your cattle to help manage the potential disease affecting your current and future herd. Johne's is an infectious, chronic, progressive wasting disease that in cattle leads to profuse and persistent scour, with severe weight loss. Learn more: https://lnkd.in/e-wzknuu

🏅This week, EIDS is back with another crucial biosecurity tip for you. Here is Tip Number 6: ✨ Isolate Sick Horses ✨ 🔹Immediately isolate any horse showing signs of illness to prevent the spread of disease to other horses. 🔹Even without stables, you can create a dedicated field space with double fencing away from other paddocks and horses. 🔹Ensure these isolation areas are well signed and taped off to prevent people from accidentally entering them. #EquineHealth #EquineVet #EquineInfectiousDiseaseSurveillance

🐶🪳Ticks carry a variety of very debilitating diseases. These include Lyme Disease, Babesia, Erlichia, Bartonella and many other diseases that can make both people and animals sick. 👉Although you may be careful when you hike or are out in “tick country”, your dog, cat, horse or other animals that you are affectionate with may bring ticks into your home, where they may transfer from your animal to you. 👉If you get bit by the tick, you are at risk of developing a painful, chronic illness. 👉Continue reading, to learn more! https://lnkd.in/eMuqiPNp #tick #lymedisease #dogtick #pethealth
